alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the western City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the southeastern City of Suffolk through 415 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whaleyville, or near Downtown Suffolk, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Downtown Suffolk around 340 PM EDT. Bowers Hill around 400 PM EDT. Chesapeake around 405 PM EDT. Deep Creek around 410 PM EDT. Cradock around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Norfolk, Portlock, Nurney, Kilby, Suffolk Airport, Herberts Corner, Saunders, Magnolia and Chesapeake Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
